author: {'steamid': '76561198184125019', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1693168258}
review: If you want to try an idle game, I totally recommend Clicker Heroes. It's free too and it's way better than this one. Here, the characters feel very empty and boring and the gameplay is worse and repetitive. At least clicker heroes served some creativity and more reasons to actually stay and play it (and the characters and mobs feel more iconic and memorable there imo). It's seriously a bootleg version of that game and I don't recommend it for an idle game

author: {'steamid': '76561198161083733', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1654527003}
review: The art design is something I like very much in this clicker, however everything else kind of fails. The UI is terrible and it's one of those clickers that seems to really dislike idle play. Given you need to constantly pay attention equipment drops to up your characters damage and such. Also finding useful info on this game is also annoying. - Not sure I'll even bother with the achievements in this game, I'll probably remove it completely to save myself the hassle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053026344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1664484567}
review:
Mont√© de niveau au click par click : c'est chiant en m√™me pas une demi journ√©e jeu. Ca devrait  √™tre la base de n'importe quel idle. Qui a envie de clicker plus de 1000x par personnages pour des up de level toutes les 5mins ?
Impossible de faire un auto-tri du stuff : on se voit donc √† rester regarder un √©cran en √©sp√©rant voir un stuff ok apparaitre pour l'equiper sous peine de le voir le voir disparaitre. C√¥t√© Idle, pas fou non plus pour rester poli.
Le "revive" n'apporte tellement peu de r√©compense qu'on a pas envie de faire un reset on a juste l'impression d'y perdre et ce d√®s le d√©but, m√™me pas √† long terme. On stagne en √†,peine 6h de jeu.
En soit le jeu pourrait √™tre sympathique mais manque ENORMEMENT de feature et se trouve √™tre beaucoup trop lent tant dans son gameplay -√† devoir fix√© des heures le stuff qui tombe- que dans les r√©compenses de reset inexistante.
Un jeu encore en tout d√©but ? Soit, je peux concevoir (et encore.). Mais les d√©fauts pr√©sent donne un niveau d'ennuie qui ne donne pas envie d'aller plus loin qu'un apr√®s midi avec du temps √† tuer. 
En bref : 
- Si vous avez du temps √† perdre, aller ailleurs. 
- Si vous avez du temps √† perdre pour en prime vouloir vous ennuyez : allez-y.
P:S : le jeu sera en √©cran r√©duit; impossible de l mettre en plein √©cran, si vous n'avez pas de lunettes de pr√©cision, soyez pr√™t √† √©clater vos r√©tines pour des infos peu utile.

review: People are crying that it is not an Idle game but it says clicker not idle.  Other than that the game is just not fun.  There are so many trash items that pop on the screen it gets annoying trying to click or find what is useful.  There is no explanation of how mechanics operate.  Overall I was bored within minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131966051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 8162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5045, 'last_played': 1668799021}
review: I have 84 hours logged in and beating zone 5 is simply not possible.  I don't have a problem with a challenge but it seems no matter what I do I simply can not progress.  I've been playing this sort of game for years...  I've never encountered a problem like this before.  It's frustrating.  I would say they want you to pay to win but monetization isn't working.  I actually tried to buy some perks to make it easier and nothing happened when I clicked payment.  huh...  So there's that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075480121', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1146, 'last_played': 1611980626}
review:
Para quem esta pensando em jogar este jogo

‚úì Pontos positivos
- O jogo √© bonito
- Cumpre sua fun√ß√£o de ser um clicker divertido
- Voc√™ passa boas horas ali sem se entediar rapidamente
- Voc√™ n√£o precisa gastar rios de dinheiro (sim, j√° vi clickers pay to win!)
- Os sons n√£o s√£o irritantes

‚úó Pontos negativos
- Bugs no jogo que fazem com que ele n√£o consiga mais abrir
- Descaso completo do criador com o pr√≥prio jogo (Sim, isso mesmo que voc√™ leu)
- Falta de atualiza√ß√µes (Desde 2017 n√£o existe UMA atualiza√ß√£o nesse jogo, ent√£o se ele bugar.... sinto muito)
- Uma total perda de tempo (devido aos motivos citados a cima, quando acontece um bug e voc√™ n√£o tem como corrigir por descaso do criador do jogo meio que te desanima)

Espero que isso ajude a mais pessoas a n√£o cairem nessa cilada, √© bonito o jogo, bem feito at√©, ele consegue te atrair bastante ao ponto de te comprar e fazer voc√™ baixar, mas n√£o vale a pena.

review: It's a pleasant game, it's not that easy, but if you want to make the achievements quickly, this method is best to farm a lot for about 4-8 hours or if you want all of them for a maximum of 1 week and then to get really bad, if you put and you put it comes even easier. The graphics are great, the achievements are quite easy if you want a relaxing game, I recommend it. I honestly liked it, it's well worth a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970388715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1583796011}
review:
The Devs posted a message saying they did not make enough money and so abandoned the game. Players further ahead in the game talk about hitting a wall where you can not progress any further. There is no fix to this as although the in game store looks to work, clicking on any purchase does nothing. 
 As of now the game is maybe worth a play just so you can check out the great art work. 
 RIP.

Kann ich zurzeit nicht empfehlen!

Anfangs spa√üig und scheinbar gut gemacht, fallen einem sofort die ersten Fehler auf. Die sammelbaren Ausr√ºstungsgegenst√§nde haben keinen automatischen Vergleich, also muss man selbst suchen, denn es werden nicht immer die schw√§chsten Gegenst√§nde ausgetauscht. Und manchmal sogar die besten, was einen DPS-Verlust bedeutet.
Offline-Gold gab es beim ersten mal offline seitdem nicht mehr.
Au√üerdem gibt es einen Fehler bei der Sterne-Berechnung, (Sterne bekommt man nach einem Aufstieg). 11 Sterne bekommen, 5 ausgegeben, 6 wurden abgezogen. Konnte somit die n√§chste Stufe nicht mitskillen.

Auch ist der Zugriff auf die Skills umst√§ndlich und zu langsam.
Ebenso wie das Aufwerten von 10 oder 50 Stufen auf einmal. Es gibt weder eine Anzeige dazu, rumprobieren zum herausfinden der Tastenkombination. Noch gibt es eine Anzeige f√ºr das aktuell ausgegebene Gold.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329335030', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1712264654}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994195296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1546484439}
review:
This game is free to play, so you're free to see yourself how this game will appeal to you. The only reasons I can think of for you to be trawling the reviews section here is: (A) to see if others liked the game as much you did, so you can feel chuffed over how good your taste is in clicker games; or (B) to see if there are others who have felt the same pain as you have, to know that you are not the only one sore of finger and empty of joy with naught in your hands and heart to show for it.

Friend B, you are not alone. I may not have spent as long in the game as you have (20 monstrously monotonous minutes), but I see the void at the end of the path we walked, and curse me for being fool enough to step upon it. I detail my grievances now, not for the sake of melodrama (actually yes I did, but let's pretend I didn't), but to exorcise the demon that is this game from my memories. In reading this, I pray that you too will have this purged from your nightmares, and that we may someday know the feeling of joy once again.

Now, for starters:

"Many unlockable heroes": Many? True, you can see that from screenshots. Unlockable? True, but getting all of them will depend on how many hours you burn. Heroes? That's the biggest stretch. You can see this yourself in the game and in the promo video. Ignore the flashy trailer SFX. Look and notice that the heroes you unlock don't actually do anything. No spells, no skills; they wave roughly in the direction of the foe and (without any kind of body contact) the foe takes damage. That's all they do.

"Randomly generating loot": True! Loot is generated, and the stats are random! Equipment pops out of monsters and you have to decide on the fly whether to equip it or replace it. But is that any kind of fun? The game calculates for you if any dropped item increases or decreases damage (the only stat in the game) so you just have to pay attention to the color of the numbers (green good! red bad!). That's like sorting balls and blocks into two separate boxes. Maybe I could make a game out of it, and then I'd have boxes to bring to St. Miriam's Home for Sad Orphans. But after this game, all I would have is this pretentious steam review for a clicker game. Those orphans would [b]bury[/b] me, and certainly not in the fun sandpit.

"Animated monsters and recruitable heroes": Well since I've already ranted about the heroes, let's reduce this to half a point and talk about the monsters, spectacularly animated to first breath in, and then breath out. They don't attack, though that would be pointless anyway because hitpoints doesn't exist here. Damage is the only stat! You mash the mouse, the monster dies, and repeat.

I can't comment on "Different areas to explore" or "Rebirth and Artifacts". Maybe this is where the game changes, or maybe they're the highlights I should have tried to grind to for a totally different experience. But I think it's a safe bet that they're not that great either, especially since the devs for this game have stopped updating (link to Logos' review mentioning this halt of content https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198440309009/recommended/557810/). I'm no expert on F2P clicker games, but please [i]please[/i] consider playing something else, or at least do not spend anything on microtransactions here. I can guarantee that the exchange rate for dollars to fun/satisfaction will [b]not[/b] be in your favor.

review:
Juego divertido, aunque no es diferente de otros "clickers". Explicar√© los pros y contras del juego, seg√∫n mi opini√≥n:

+++ PROS +++
+ No necesitas estar jugando (ni tan siquiera conectado al juego) para conseguir monedas y avanzar, as√≠ que puedes dejarlo hacer mientras est√°s en otras cosas.
+ Vas avanzando relativamente f√°cil y sin muchas complicaciones.
+ Hasta un punto, no se nota demasiado el "pay2win" ni necesitas comprar algo con dinero real.


--- CONTRAS ---
- Llega un punto en el que, s√≠ o s√≠, necesitas invertir dinero real para poder avanzar, pues los monstruos son demasiado fuertes y dejan poco dinero.
- Aunque hay diferentes mapas, al final se hace mon√≥tono.
- Es pr√°cticamente igual a cualquier otro clicker, no a√±adiendo nada nuevo.


En definitiva, yo le dar√≠a un 6/10, ya que aunque s√≠ es cierto que al inicio se avanza r√°pido y en general es divertido, llega un momento en el que "te estancas" y la √∫nica forma de salir de ah√≠ es reiniciando (que no a√±ade nada nuevo y te obliga a volver sobre tus pasos) o pagando con dinero real.

review:
Le pire clicker que j'ai pus tester.

Il a une bonne musique, de jolie "heros" meme si trop petit...
un systeme d'√©quipement plus ou moins "utile", meme si ces souvent grace a ceux la qu'ont gagne en dps...

Mais a coter...
Le re-start est ultra d√©primant, la progression est aussi lente qu'avant, meme si ont investi des cristaux (eux meme tres dur a avoir) et au final ont a aucun sentiment de reel progression...

Tres frustrant.

de tout les clicker, il est celui ou il y a le moins de satisfaction de re-start... Sa donne clairement pas envie de recomencer une fois le 1er ou deuxieme renouveau effectuer...

pr√©f√©r√© plus insanity clicker ou soda dungeons, largement plus fun

review:
Hallo

Ich habe das Spiel eine zeitlang gespielt und finde es √∂de und Langweillig. Es gibt keine Questen die man absolvieren kann oder ein Crafting System. Und bei diesem Spiel muss man immer dran bleiben selbst wenn die Helden automatisch k√§mpfen das Gear der Helden droppt bei besiegten Gegner und verschwindet dann relativ schnell wieder. Die Grafik ist f√ºr ein Clicker spiel ziemlich gut gelungen.
Ich pers√∂nlich Beforzuge aber diese Spiele

https://store.steampowered.com/app/627690/Idle_Champions_of_the_Forgotten_Realms/
Mit offizieler D&D Lizenz.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/402840/Crusaders_of_the_Lost_Idols/
Sind beide kostenlos auf Steam Verf√ºgbar.

Positives
- Gute Grafik f√ºr ein Clicker Game
- Viele Helden zum rekutieren

Negatives
- Loot verschwindet viel zu schnell
- Dauert ewig stellweise bis man weiterkommt wenn man Free spielt
- Kein Craftingsystem
- Sehr hoher Speicherplatzbedarf 2-3 Gigabyte
- Keine Aufgaben oder Events

author: {'steamid': '76561198003970062', 'num_games_owned': 2038, 'num_reviews': 355, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1511239940}
review:
Clicker Guild is a fairly standard clicker game, but with a slight twist. Like games like Hero Clicker, you ostensibly control a group of heroes; the heroes all attack on their own, while you can upgrade yourself to improve your clicks.

Unlike many such games, the heroes you hire are actually displayed on-screen; they stand around the enemy and, rather than dealing a constant DPS, swing their weapons and deal damage when their swings connect. Adding to the complexity, they have a chance to critically hit, and unlike most such games, the enemies drop equippable items; each hero has three slots, and the item is automatically assigned to one of them when you pick them up. This adds a small element of strategy to the game ‚Äì the items sometimes have slightly variable abilities, and while it is obvious that some are better than others, and they get better over time, deciding whether to prioritize, say, criticals or straight-up damage is at least one more choice than most such games have.

However, the game is still at its heart the same thing as every other clicker game; you click on enemies to deal damage, your heroes idly deal damage even when you aren‚Äôt clicking, and you have a handful of special abilities with cooldowns to temporarily boost your output of clicks or passive damage output. You can buy new heroes, or you can upgrade existing ones, and each one has a new (usually passive) ability that unlocks at levels 25, 50, 75, 100, and 150. Because of the scaling, it is mostly not really worth upgrading heroes above level 150, as the new heroes are better/more efficient and the upgrades are linear rather than quadratic, meaning that adding +1 level to your first guy is always about the same ‚Äì thus, going from level 1 to 2 is a huge jump, but going from 150 to 151 is not even noticeable.

Unfortunately, like many such games, there comes a point at which you hit a brick wall and must ‚Äúascend‚Äù, restarting the game from scratch. And herein lies the rub ‚Äì the game really gives you poor rewards for ascension. Like all clicker games, you gain some static boost, but in this game, the boost is very small indeed ‚Äì you gain ‚Äústars‚Äù, which can be spent on permanently raising some global attributes, but the boosts are very small and the star cost is large compared to how much you get for ascending. This means that even after five ascensions, getting past the start of the fifth area (which is actually 40 levels in, as each area is split up into 10 zones, though the differences are purely aesthetic) remained basically impossible unless you waited an hour for a cooldown timer to expire. The game becomes extraordinarily grindy at that point, and it never got better, unlike other clicker games, where at least you can make additional progress after ascending.

That being said, this at least felt like a bit more than blindly clicking, though only a very marginal amount more. It still remains the same old core, bog-standard gameplay, with only very minor adjustments, and there also seemed to be a bug preventing some characters from having items spawn for them at all.

All in all, this is not something I‚Äôd suggest for general audiences to get, but if you‚Äôre a clicker fiend, this is at least a bit different while still being mostly the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099234862', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1586158448}
review:
Rather scruffy clicker with usual humdrum mechanics, disappointing interface, and some visual enhancements over the basic idea of the "Clicker Heroes". With standard stonewalls problem and some inconvenient bugs.

On the positive side, now the heroes you're hiring are pictured on the main game screen, and not only in the "hire a hero" section of GUI. The game goes even farther and providing you with various drop items, which some of your characters can use to improve their abilities. That's a step upon the "Clicker Heroes", where items and inventory are implemented as a fifth wheel. Well, but that step ahead went not without some foul up. As those drop items are spreading around in the main screen, making the process of basic quick clicking quite slippery. At least if you're care about what item you want, and what - not.

Now, what's the bad sides? For one, the interface, which is seriously lacking. There are no visible statistic, you can't presume which of your actions are making sense, and which are not. The variety of upgrades and things to do rather than basical clicking and buying 1000+ level to another of you "heroes" - is basically nil. So I really doubt that someone will be using this "game" for thousands hours of unstoppable clicking. Even if you'll try, well, there are bugs, which will stop your progress quite fast.

So, forget about collecting the whole lot of achievements from this clicker, it's so dull after the first 3-5 levels, having so little content, that it's strongly NOT recommended even for hard-headed fans of "Clicker heroes". Stay away, people, it's 2/10 mark just for looks, but the gameplay is dull and broken.

review: Fun, but sadly abandoned. Looks like the devs did an update 1 day after the Steam release and haven't been seen since. Game is incomplete, full of bugs, some that are gamebreaking when you progress to a certain point. I had to discover some of the keybinds myself because there's nothing I see to indicate them. I'm sure I still haven't found all of them. Fun enough to pass the time, and it had so much potential, but unfortunately it looks like it will never get there.

review:
Wahrscheinlich das beste Clicker Spiel das momentan auf Steam ist, dennoch auch nur wieder halb zu Ende gebracht.
Interface gibt einem keine n√ºtzlichen Informationen wie Stats der einzelnen Helden oder wieviel es kostet 10 Level auf einmal aufzuwerten, wird Crit chance in die DPS mit eingerechnet, wieviel Sterne bekommt man beim Reset?
Keine Lautst√§rke Regelung im Optionsmen√º.
Warum kein Crafting? Warum keine Effekte oder irgendwelche interessanten Animationen? Warum kein Skill-Tree der einzelnen Helden?
Man kann bei diesem Spiel nicht verlieren egal was man tut warum also nicht dem Spieler ein bisschen Freiheit zum Experimentieren geben?

author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2594, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1491512244}
review:
Rather scruffy clicker with usual humdrum mechanics, disappointing interface, and some visual enhancements over the basic idea of the "Clicker Heroes". With standard stonewalls problem and some inconvenient bugs.

On the positive side, now the heroes you're hiring are pictured on the main game screen, and not only in the "hire a hero" section of GUI. The game goes even farther and providing you with various drop items, which some of your characters can use to improve their abilities. That's a step upon the "Clicker Heroes", where items and inventory are implemented as a fifth wheel. Well, but that step ahead went not without some foul up. As those drop items are spreading around in the main screen, making the process of basic quick clicking quite slippery. At least if you're care about what item you want, and what - not.

Now, what's the bad sides? For one, the interface, which is seriously lacking. There are no visible statistic, you can't presume which of your actions are making sense, and which are not. The variety of upgrades and things to do rather than basical clicking and buying 1000+ level to another of you "heroes" - is basically nil. So I really doubt that someone will be using this "game" for thousands hours of unstoppable clicking. Even if you'll try, well, there are bugs, which will stop your progress quite fast.

So, forget about collecting the whole lot of achievements from this clicker, it's so dull after the first 3-5 levels, having so little content, that it's strongly NOT recommended even for hard-headed fans of "Clicker heroes". Stay away, people, it's 2/10 mark just for looks, but the gameplay is dull and broken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030245310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 3523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3498, 'last_played': 1491278338}
review: If you like clicker type games yes its decent.  It does have a lot of problems and really their isn't much to do.  You can idle a lot.  But where the game allows you to idle it also punishes for doing so.  The game is constantly dropping loot to increase damage and if you aren't interacting with picking up the loot that disappears in seconds you can easily fall behind.  I'd give it a 4/10 since I don't like clicker games much.  But, others might enjoy it more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078937587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1490394790}
review:
Despite the fact that the graphical side of this game is really well done, it completely lacks any fun system whatsoever. Its classical mindless click and upgrade game. The equipment in this game only improves dps, so there is no space for making tactics to get your army to be more efficient and leveling faster.  And although your equipment makes a difference, every playthrought feels like its going with the same constant speed. Boring.  The numbers in damage are here just to give you feel that you have actually power over the dps. But YOU DONT. Active skills impact on game is minimal, which is pretty usual pattern in clicker games. I still havent found out why are developers putting them in...

The tip of the iceberg is Ascension. The functionality used often in clicker games to make them last longer by restarting the game, but giving you sort of a compensation for your spend time, that will make next playthrought easier. In this game it rewards you with pretty much nothing. I DO NOT RECOMEND USING ASCENSION. Its unfinished feature that shouldnt have been put in the game in the first place. Certainly not in this state.

Final verdict: If you are intrigued by the graphics and wonder about what do all enemies and soldiers look like, give it a try. Maybe you will be driven by curiosity. But if you look for fun, challenge, or the way to improve your tactital thinking, turn around and keep searching. This game is not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043284999', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1488755573}
review:
There seems to be a game breaking BUG, best you look into the forums first before playing. (Something with restarting the game and loosing DPS when opening it again.)


Review:

~ General ~
You have to kill Monsters in stages of 10 in stages of 10. Every 10th Monster is a boss with a (standard) 10s timer.  Monster kills give you always currency and equipment every here and then. 
It's not a regular clicker as you may know from "Clicker Heroes" but still pretty similar. It's more active then most clickers, more a collector game type. 
Bots will have a harder life here.

~ Look ~
Interesting and appealing Art Style in the beginning, ends in all characters you can achive look pretty similar. (Grey/Brown, similar face, pretty similar armor)

~ System ~
Here you have to really activly collect dropped items for ALL your characters to advance them. All characters have 5 abbilities to boost themself, give you % currency drop chances or give you a skill to activate with cooldown. To get the abilities of the characters you level them up with currency. You can click yourself too as your clicks are scaling with the combined DPS all your characters. There are Items to boost up the characters after capping at level 150.

About every 3rd Monster you get a Part of Equipment, somewhere every 20th a Equipment part for your Hero and every so 50th a chest (coins and/or equipment in it).  
Items have a damage base and better ones have 1 or more % bonuses on them. Everytime you kill a boss all your items with % bonuses lose some % of them. (Eg. before boss 25% - after boss 22%)
There is some tiering in the items, not every item has a % bonus on them. Seems like all tiers drop normaly but you also can skip that with buying "Diamond Chests"

Also all equipment will be lost aswell as all characters (2nd part as we know from other clickers) after ascending. 
There are bonuses for ascending you can level up with "Stars", the game doesn't tell you how much stars you get for an ascencion. The given bonuses are very small from so far... (not noticable at all for first ascencion as you get 1 or 2 level....)

Your clicks will scale with the overall DPS of all your characters but so far I know you can just close the game and it will just run further and collect coins and convert the dropped items in currency also.


~ Free to Play? ~
You can buy Diamond Chests which give you really "good" items. But why would you do that? You get an item which is scrap after 5-6 bosses AND lost when ascending anyways. 
There is also a dmg multiplyer in shop (times 2) but only 1 time purchasable. 
Aaaand a cooldown reset you have to buy everytime you want to use it. 



I don't really like the approach of the items you get... Better back to a real clicker. 
Btw seems like developers are not there anymore to support that game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034528121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1674, 'last_played': 1488829785}
review:

-Cons :

-Good Decent Gear drops at Low drop rates .

-balance issues on some lvls and monsters being OP and to hard to kill or hero cost and upgrades being to expansive .

- upgrading a hero in this game does not have that much impact on dps as Gear does  better gear gives best dps  perioed 
so you no gathering it wont progres you and keeping watch over the game all the time stops it from being Idle clicker .

overall its free try it . but overall it needs more work .

author: {'steamid': '76561197970477606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7701, 'last_played': 1486504438}
review:
Check the Steam forums first.

Game breaking bugs and ignoring the community for, as of this review, two months after release.

Absolutely awesome game with great features (loot drop) that I really like for a clicker/idle, but due to the nasty issues with gold, skill calculation and useless leveling up heroes past level 150, please just pass.

Feel free to fire it up due to it being "free" and check out how much this game CAN be great, but do as I did and spend zero real money as you will rapidly realize your cash was wasted by sending to a development team that vanished after Steam release.

Edit: March 28, 2017
1.5 months AFTER posting the above review, the top unpinned discussion is still asking if the devs are ignoring the game...

review: Hm... I love this game... BUT it is quite "buggy" (lots of faults in the way the game works, or rather does not work)... For instance, the more heroes you have or the bigger the boss you are fighting, the slower the game will be and the less responsive your clicks are, but the worst bug is the one where the user interface is completely lost and your clicks are not registered and the game does not progress at all etc and you have to close and re-open the game. I would recommend this, were it not for the bugs, but sadly, as-is, I cannot recommend it.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198067109116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8261, 'last_played': 1486888003}
review:
As of now, not worth playing, grindy as hell, last hero accounts for 99 percent of your total dps at some point. 

Offline money is kinda random, switching the game off might wipe off some equipment. 

Ascending is boring, stars obtained after said ascencion barely enable any upgrade. P2W for 2x perma dps. 

Made it to lvl 7.x, where I would pray for crits mostly, and only from one hero, wtf?

author: {'steamid': '76561198069241210', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1485449835}
review:
I'm kind of an idle/clicker game addict, so when I saw this I was so excited! However, the game starts out EXTREMELY LOUD and there's no way to turn the sounds down, only off. So that was kind of a turn off to start out with.

Then, there's no tutorial or explanation to the game. I didn't need one, but still it's helpful for those who haven't played many idle games. The item system is cool, but could be better. Instead of automatically replacing the items (with no notification except for epic/legendary items) it would be nice to collect them in a chest to sell or replace other items later. 

All in all, not a bad game but I only played it for like 10 minutes max. and I just didn't like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028013238', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1253, 'last_played': 1526347093}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973581774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 7438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1679, 'last_played': 1602961410}
review:
Update Post (11/12/2017)
Bugs still preset.
Got to a higher level zone than normal, quit for the night, log back in to have 0.0 Gold and to have gotten "0.0 Gold while away"  to make matters worse - no gold pick up would work, having to forcefully use the rebirth system to get any gold at all.

No fixes in nearly a yaer?  Unprofessional.  Would be a fun, hard, clicker game if not for all the bugs that literally break the game progress and force restarting before ready, and reward so little your power never feels like it's going up.

Still do not reccomend the game, still has original problems and more. Doesn't look like the company knows what it is doing. Avoiding "Fox Dawn" now, another junk Dev/Publisher that is trying to make a quick buck without finishing the games they start.



// Original Post//
Too many problems to enjoy.
Balance issue is terrible.
Away bug not giving/displaying proper gold (forcing to keep playing if you want to advance at all)
Giant Brick wall that can only be avoided if you go to zone 3, ascend, repeatedly and use the "free stars" to boost your world STR/Crit so you can do more DPS. (very boring process too)  By repeatedly I mean over 100x as each time only seems to give 5 stars.

DPS doesn't increase past level 150.  Known bug- no fix.
Skills not working at all - or shutting off early - or not working properly in general.  Skill use is also extremely clunky - as you go to another tab/menu, scroll down to use it, and if you return to the buy heroes it's at the top again too - very cumbersome to always start at top of scroll lists instead of "where you left off"

This game should NOT have been released as/is - it is a ALPHA game as it is, and should be addressed properly. (Alpha means there are core problems being worked out or added to it that will shape the entire game, like adding Jumping to a platform game)

Fox Dawn needs to re-think how to balance things for the Gold required to level up the heroes VS the damage they dish out - relying too heavily on RNG Equipment drops is poor game mechanics.
//////////////////////////

author: {'steamid': '76561198060199698', 'num_games_owned': 1617, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1485362966}
review: Good concept, shitty game mechanics. You can't idle or else the good loot is gone. I can't see any difference between the other clicker games.No more updates for a while, dispite being a new game. The equipment idea is terrible especially if Ascension is suppose to make you stronger, you lose all the hard found loot to ascend, really no point to the loot mechanic

author: {'steamid': '76561198102812607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1148, 'last_played': 1613368200}
review: This game may have a tasteful variety of options in comparison to the other tap-based games out there, but it is still a bug filled mess. At points, it seems as if the damage would glitch out and although should deal 100x (hypothetically) the monster's max health, it does not. The snowballing effect seems to be very long for this game in particular and looking at the achievements, some may not even be achievable. At first glance this game may seem appealing, but after just a few hours of seeing how its mechanics operate, it's not so much appealing thereafter. With a few more bug fixes, I would for sure rejoin and try it out again, but in its occuring state, I will have to pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302860207', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1495038053}
review: The game is a great time killer if you are waiting for some stuff you need to door someone to come to your house. I'd recommend it for that reason and that reason alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048418886', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1586382277}
review: Good game

author: {'steamid': '76561198081860215', 'num_games_owned': 1646, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1486594676}
review: Kinda click around a screen but don't really have to if my team of bandits are strong enough. Which up until level 4-2 - 4-3 is easy enough before it takes a really hard sharp turn in difficulty. It's addictive, sure. The music is one of the better soundtracks in one of these clicker games. It just that the whole thing feels cheap. The replay is when you ascend and start all over and earn some stars which you can cash in for a particular attribute that gives your team a bonus which helps out like increase global strength or increase global crit hit but to what end? Do I just click until my inevitable death? Or is there a carrot at the end of the stick? Even ascending 4 times, I am still nowhere near strong enough to see past about 4-9ish (maybe 4-10). It's not a bad game. I just think there are many ways you could better spend your time. Not to mention that if you close the game and open it several days later, the amount of money you would have accrued with the game left open is not the same and that seems kinda broken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027666873', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1493021782}
review:
When I leave the game my total DPS is always diveded by 4.
When I leave the game I don't get ANY offline-money.
When you purchase something for stars, you always pay the stars of what the next level would require, not the current one.
This makes the game pretty annoying and unsatisfying (is this correct?, sorry for my bad english)
Of course I see that you put a lot of effort into this game, but you need to correct some gamebreaking stuff before I'm able to recommend this game. The animations and characters are nice, but that's all. But keep it up to update your game and it will be better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966308041', 'num_games_owned': 1344, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1653, 'last_played': 1494200056}
review:
Don't play right now!

As a free to play clicker game it has promise, but it is riddled with bugs and inconsistencies.   Quitting the game has a chance of resetting your DPS to nearly 0 and earning no gold offline.

There is an ascension feature, but since you lose everything for a platry amount of the currency to up your stats, you are better off powering through.

The equipment is a nice feature, it needs tweaked so that it replaces your weakest item instead of your oldest.  With as many drops that go on at the same time, it can get hectic to scroll through your available characters, compare all 3 items with the drop and sell the weakest/sell the item. Funny thing though the amount of drops makes it the fun hectic, but the lack of a proper replacement system make it a bad hectic.  I get rushes from finding epic/legendary loot, only to misclick and sell it because it was the oldest thing in my hero's inventory.

Fix offline mode, fix the inventory system and I would recommend wholeheartedly. As it is now, just wait to see if it is fixed since losing all your progress really sucks in these types of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077273766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 13468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3282, 'last_played': 1490714094}
review:
At 41 hours I find this to be an OK clicker game.  It has a few flaws, like not displaying how many stars you'll receive when you ascend which makes it hard to determine whether you should keep slogging.  However this might get added in a patch as the game is just newly released.

It shows all of your heroes on the attack screen and they all get an attack animation.   It differs from most clicker games in adding loot.   The loot determines your overall attack power much more than your actual player level does.  Each hero (there are about 30 in total) gets their own special loot, which always improves as you increase in monster wave level.  The game is not really much of an idle game as it requires active clicking to continually improve your loot, which is a plus or negative depending on your refered play style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007471259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 1493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1546441498}
review: 4/10 currently... The game is fun for the first 5h or so, achievements pop up regularly (although currently I am at ca. 34%, and will stop playing the game, the remaining achievements are out of scope!), you get stronger... until you hit a wall... and then you realize how badly the game is balanced... after the newest patch, items you find are mostly worse than what you have, but would influence your power more than all the skills you can upggrade your heroes in... however, money income becomes superslow, so you dont progress anymore... now, you say, why not reset or rebirth? Because it would give me 5 points, but my cheapest upgrade requires 7 units!!! Which would be a 0.5% increase to one stat!? Even after I did reset, and reached the same point again, no progress at all, and that was even before the patch, where better equipment dropped! A failure of a Clicker game... unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127083207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1483179721}
review:
Its a clicker hero rehash and not as good, they even use all of the same terminology (ascention, gold [using all the !@#$%^ like clicker heros does without the option to change to scientific notation]) The game is fun for the first few hours and then you realize its going to take an eternity to get anywhere with it.
 The blue stars that you need to get ingame bonuses after ascention come at a rate of 1.75 per floor and after 3 hours of game play ive only accumulated 7 stars(their idle/afk system is almost nonexistant unless you want to leave the game running in the background. I also would not reccomend this because it takes up a lot more ram then it should.) The lowest price for an upgrade is 5% to damage for 5 stars. then it goes up to 5 %more for 6 stars.

Given this game just came out a few weeks ago and it would be simple to change the stars system i would give it a 3/10 for now. If the star system was fixed and allowed for smother progression i would up it to a 6/10, and if they added a more fluid idle system with the game is closed along with the stars being fixed, i would rate it at a 9/10 (not a 10/10 for the sole fact they coppied clicker heros for names)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035383340', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 2113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1581931697}
review: This is another fantasy clicker game of clicking monster killing. Is it fun? Yes, the grabbing gear to equip to your group characters and clicking away to help melt the monsters and bosses is addicting. The artwork is fun, cartoony and unlocking more and more group characters to buy is always fun to see what the next one is/looks like. Hire more group characters, unlocks the next one. Upgrade your group characters with gold so they get better and do more damage and learn skills. Skills sometimes give you a global skill or just increase DPS or gold gain. Witch is good. Gold and equipment do drop from the monsters. Equipment shows green if its an improvement for that group character and red if it isn't. So quickly just sell it if you don't need it. This makes for good gold boosts. SO hire and upgrade more group characters and grab the equipment that drops if your able. This makes the game a SEMI-idle game with the equipment. There is lots of achievements, so that's neat. Stars do global upgrades witch you gain from ascending ( starting over). These permanently stay. Honestly the artwork is cool with the display of, instead of just the monster being clicked at, that you see your group characters grouped around the monster fighting him out with looped attack movements. It's something different. CLICK CLICK D&D really.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054030612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1926, 'last_played': 1543466764}
review:
The art style to this game is probably the best I have seen from a clicker game and the loot mechanic is a very unique and cool addition to the gyme type.

However, they are really the only positive things I can say about this game. That characters take a lot of money to upgrade and the grind to get that money is a long boring stretch. At the time of writing this I have 167 hours of game time logged with only roughly 10 hours of that being active use of the game (Do not take this as I love the game, I just have an addictive personality and continuously have about 5 clickers games open at any one time). The money accumulation when the game is closed only lasts an hour and you only get a pittence, forcing you to leave the game open in the background for extended periods of time to make any headway. I have also noted that when left open for too long, say 8 or 9 hours, it causes my computer to slow down considerably.

For a free game it is decent but a little too active to be an idle game that shows results in a realistic time frame such as Clicker Heroes or Sakura Clicker.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998475736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1527433949}
review:
I haven't played many clicker games, but the "loot" part drew me to this one (for those who like procedural loot, this isn't the kind of loot you think, also it "decays" so you have to constantly replace it). I can only say it's "OK", cause it has plenty bugs, but the dev is working on it constantly; it gets patched pretty often. I had some fun, but probably won't play it much, to be honest.

EDIT: Well, gotta say "dev *WAS* working on it". Seems the development stopped for some reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969402037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1482867191}
review:
A "clicker" type game unlike all the others. Just because it's "Free" does it mean it's good? In the case of Clicker Guild, once you are past a certain level things will become more clear. You'll need "Crystal" 

Pros:
-Unique "loot" drop mechanic. Although most of the items are the same, just higher & higher item level as you progress
-Good user interface/UI function

Cons:
-No fullscreen. Have to run a command launch option
-No proper "Exit" game functionality. Have to cont., alt., delete to end
-Game must be running in background if you wish to grind gold while idle
-A strong emphasis on in-game purchases in order to maximize character(s) potential and hasten progress; "Crystals"

author: {'steamid': '76561198236555546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1482376534}
review:
-No- for now. Hoping to update in a few months when more work has been done on it.


It's fun at the start but then you realise that the items spam out and if you aren't there they get sold after 10 seconds, so your gold will go up but your power will not if you're afk.

While the save issue if fixed which is good, you don't earn any gold offline at all (came back with some random scientific number x 1998897 numbers and letters and no gold was added, so guess that's busted for here and now)

You will hit a wall. Without offline earnings, your choice is to let the game run for hours while you left click upgrades or right click to sell, or pool gold by leaving the game on for hours and hours.

WTB offline earnings to get around the curve in monster hp walls you encounter please devs.

A few changes to the above and some more depth to the gear system and this is a YES.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003007913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 11087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1960, 'last_played': 1488430186}
review:
Decently fun click idler, very similar to clicker heroes. As far as these kinds of games go it is pretty solid, with (hopefully) more improvements on the way. 

Love the loot. It would be nice if there was an "at a glance" way to see how each piece changed your "global stats" for DPS, Gold %, and Gold +

It seems that in Zone 5 the game stops progressing rapidly, and ascension does not provide a very large boost (think Adventure Capitalist, where restarting can be enormous.)

Will certainly keep an eye on this one for further developments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008807312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1482430256}
review:
Tbh, i only wanted the trading cards from it, which i later found out that i couldn`t get unless i bought some shit worth like 8 bucks. 
But the weird thing is...i didn`t stop playing it xd. This little shit is ...oddly satisfying...dunno why though, cause the design is  kinda Schei√üe. Maybe it`s cause of the fact that you can go ahead and do your thing for a few h and leave this thingy on and find yourself a little fortune when you get back . But this has a downside to it, because while you`re idling, you also get some items dropped from the monsters your characters mercilessly destroy..and those items disappear after a few seconds, unless you`re there to save the day and click click click!
Another thing. Ascension. AAAh, the great ascension. Yeah, clicked that shit and lost all my progress just to get some freakin stars. Needless to say, that was the moment i stopped playing.
But hey! If you`re bored and want to kill some much needed time off your life, play awayyyy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030935422', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1482436563}
review:
This game has some serious balancing and design issues.

First, the game isn't really idle - main mechanic is about looting items that drop from monsters, and for that you have to be actively playing the game (items disappear after several seconds). 

Second, the reason why looting the items is the main mechanic is because item quality keeps increasing as your average item strength grows. No matter which zone you are in or what heroes you have. So you could practically stay in one zone and keep looting better and better gear. And power from gear quickly overshadows base strength from heroes.

Third, because of the looting mechanic, and how gear becomes the main source of power - gold becomes useless. At first it may not seem that way because you keep unlocking new heroes which at first are stronger than gear. But as you reach final heroes you find out that gear is the only way forward and there is no point buying further levels for heroes.

Fourth, you quickly learn that the only factor affecting the speed of your progress is the speed at which you loot items. Which means that it's actually preferable to NOT move into further zones and just keep farming gear on monster which die in 1 second. Oh, you can't go back to earlier zones, so getting forward actually means slowing your progress (monster die slower -> you loot less items -> item strength grows slower)

Fifth, gear stats are messed up. Bonuses that increase critical damage or chance are useless. Bonuses that increase gold drops are useless because gold is useless. Bonuses that increase damage by percentage are useless, because they increase it by percentage of base strength, before items are applied. The only meaningful bonus is the flat damage increase.

Sixth, ascension bonuses are useless once you understand that 5% damage increase can be attained by simply looting items for 2 more minutes. Boss timer bonus is useless because you simply don't want / need to go ahead, because that will only slow your progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006563527', 'num_games_owned': 3471, 'num_reviews': 909, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1482105561}
review:
Clicker Guild ist ein Free-to-Play Clicker-2D-RPG. Das sog. Klicker-System hat sich mittlerweile in verschiedene Subgenres eingebracht, zunehmend auch bei den RPGs, die ja ohnehin bei seinen Action-RPGs und Hack'n Slay Titeln wahre Click-Orgien im Genre haben. Da passen Spieles dieses Konzepts dann auch durchaus hinein. Clicker Guild ist dabei erstmal ganz klassisch aufgebaut: Wir fangen an auf Monster zu klicken bis sie tot umfallen und Gold hinterlassen. Damit rekrutieren und verbessern wir neue Helden. Recht bald h√∂ren wir mit dem eigenen Klicken aber wieder auf und konzentrieren uns darauf die Helden zu pushen die automatisch Schaden pro Sekunde verteilen. Die wachsende Schar helden massakriert dann fr√∂hlich Massen an Monster und immer wieder Bossmonster am Ende eines Spielabschnitts. Der gro√üe Unterschied der das Game auch wirklich interessant macht, wir sammeln Loot ein mit dem wir die Helden ausr√ºsten. Dadurch erhalten wir auch anf√§ngliche Helden die ansonsten schnell durch zu geringe DPS-Werte w√ºrden als Aktivposten da sie massiv aufgewertet werden durch das Loot. Grafisch ist das Spiel im 2D-Comicstil, was recht typisch ist und ganz h√ºbsch aussieht und animiert wurde. Gro√üartig Story, Spieltiefe, Quests oder √§hnliches kann man aber Clickertypisch nicht erwarten. Hier wird auf das wesentlichste reduziert: Metzeln und raffen. Mir pers√∂nlich werden so Spiele ja zu schnell zu langweilig, aber das ist Geschmackssache.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HN6NrjJQbXM

author: {'steamid': '76561197983152591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1482326136}
review:
Go play Clicker Hero for now. It's the same game minus the loot and the characters don't loop a single attack animation. On every other point it's a more mature game with much better functionality. 

So far the game feels rough and has a few bugs that make it. There's still a lot of work that needs to be done to make sure everything they wanted to display actually displays. I've had money not show up, skills not appear, skill upgrades not work. It's not unplayable but it takes away much of what you would want to actively do. Otherwise you're watching numbers.

Speaking of numbers. The numbers are opaque. There's nowhere to go to look and comprehensively see why your numbers are doing this or that unless you want to grab a bunch of disparate numbers and do the math yourself. So there's little to do even optimizing your strategy. 

The loot system as the one mechanic that would save this game is bad. The loot has to be constantly micromanaged because it automatically just replaces the oldest slot with whatever you picked up. And it's on a time limit or else the loot vanishes. Only 3 pieces of loot for global bonuses follow you between restarts and the rest are dumped. Which makes the whole buying (with money) chests kinda stupid. 

The resets are slow and the currency (stars) gained per reset is pitifully small for the progress you make. The offline gains are similarly pitiful. 8 hours of offline gold equals about 5 minutes active time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201134233', 'num_games_owned': 2014, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 12770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7791, 'last_played': 1527183945}
review:
TL;DR
This game should be early access. The core seems quite finished, but it is far from polished.
I have allmost 10k hours on Clicker Heroes and 7k hours on Time Clickers, so I know my way around clicker games by now.
There are just too many aspects that are not clear, unbalanced or even broken.
For now I do not recommend it until the major bugs are fixed, but I would really like to recommend it in the future.

Pros:
- The art is nice
- Relic (equipment) system for heroes (though unbalanced)
- Real idle clicker game (idle in the sense that you are not required to fight the monsters yourself)
- Treasure chests can contain more than just gold
- Ascending system
- Clicking actually helps also in the later stages of the game
- Options to help reduce CPU usage
- Plenty of heroes
- Plenty achievements
- Low CPU usage even though there are a lot of animations
- Use Shift to buy 10x or Ctrl for 50x upgrades for a hero.

Cons:
- Some ascension upgrades cost more than they display (e.g. it shows the price is 5 stars, but it is actually 6)
- Some achievements are bugged (e.g. you reach 1 billion cash and you get the achievement for 100 million)
- You cannot know how many stars you get on ascension (I consider this a bug, since it is a major flaw and breaks the gameplay for a clicker game)
- Gold gained while Idle is not worth it at all, I got more gold by leaving the game open for 1 hour than closed for 10 hours.
- Display of gold amounts is not consistent. "You received 1.23423423423423e17 while you were offline", yea great, is that 1 quintillion or 0.1 quintillion, or perhaps 10 quintillion?
- No zone or level navigation, so no optimal cash farming
- Appearently Shift and Ctrl help you buy more upgrades at the same time, but this is nowhere explained or visible.
- Some heroes's faces aren't visible because of UI elements overlapping
- Icons aren't intu√Øtive, for example, the chest icon does not navigate to the equipment section, but the ascension section.
- Equipment for higher level heroes are damage bound, you cannot get equipment for high level heroes when your damage is too low, you need to farm relics until you can.
- Most females are scantly clothed (con in my opinion)
- Relics drop like mad and disappears quite quickly, which practically removes the idle part of the game (yes, I know it is not tagged as such)
- No mannualy saving
- Legendary relics are flawed, they may help you for 5 levels, but after that the common relics are catching up, yet you get a pop-up asking whether you are sure the common item with 100x more dps should replace the relic with three +0% bonusses (not kidding, this is a real example and happens all the time).
- Found relics seem to target the relic spots where an epic or legendary relic is equipt instead of just randomly selecting a slot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107326859', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1482259462}
review:
Hello, I would suggest that you make your priority when releasing a game testing for bugs. A big bug for me is that what I earn offline does not actually go into my balance.

When you fix this and some others I would gladly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081340622', 'num_games_owned': 5267, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1482269461}
review:
GOSH DAT SOUNDTRACK! Some of the songs in here are divine, like they're from a good JRPG.

The rest is crap to the end. Bugs here, there, and under the carpet too. This is a game that takes advantage of our fascination for big numbers and it can't even calculate stats correctly.

In the end I got bored, launched myself a quick Cheat Engine (because you don't expect me to pay for a game that's only there to catch a whale, right? You know whale fishing is forbidden?), gave myself max stats for all characters, max stars, max level on star things, and that was the most satisfying thing in the game-- just giving myself stuff more quickly than the game does.

Even if you max out everything, and set game speed to x500, you'll still end up with ridiculous amounts of time needed to reach the next area (and yes, ascensions are worthless). You'll finish the first 4 or 5 first worlds in 10 seconds. Then sometimes *minutes* per fight in later areas (of which there are only 8 -- after that it just loops back to 1). Okay sure guys. I'm hard to please when it comes to clickers, but this one has nothing for itself.

And I wasted 2 hours of my life on that when I could have been playing Abz√ª in the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964026234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1482248374}
review: It's a clicker game. That sums it up. It rapidly becomes tedious, there are 0 instructions, and within 5 minutes it becomes clear exactly what you're going to be doing the entire time. I'm not even sure if its buggy because I didn't play long enough to find out. It took longer to download than I spent playing it. Don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005471470', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1350, 'last_played': 1635118621}
review:
Interesting concept, ARPG meets clickers. Tho the idea is interesting there is currently too many bugs and imformation not displayed properly at this time of review.

Would i recommend? yes!

Tho i would wait for a few more fixies before tho.

One of the game breakingbugs is all your gold dropping and the calcuator not adding what your getting. Honetly this isnt too bad this the main progression seems to come from the loot itself rather than the lvls achieved (afer getting your last hero)

author: {'steamid': '76561198095917598', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 1815, 'playtime_forever': 3819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1676476025}
review:
Bom vamos l√° pessoal, oque dizer sobre o Clicker Guild:

Breve Descri√ß√£o :

O jogo Clicker Guild √© mais um dos famosos jogos no estilo "Idle", ou tamb√©m conhecidos como Clickers!

O game segue a mesma linha dos demais do g√™nero, porem o seu maior diferencial √© o sistema de loot, aonde cada vez que voc√™ derrota um monstro existe a chance dele dropar um tipo de equipamento no ch√£o, com uma certa raridade que varia de comum a lend√°rio!

Voc√™ possui em torno de 10 segundos para analisar se este item √© um upgrade para seus personagens, ou se voc√™ quer simplesmente vende-lo!

Os gr√°ficos do jogo s√£o bem bacanas, e a trilha sonora escolhida √© muito boa tamb√©m! Essa combina√ß√£o torna o jogo um grande atrativo!

Recomendo para aqueles que gostam de passar um tempo jogando um clicker!

An√°lise:

Pontos Positivos:

* Gr√°ficos bem polidos.
* √ìtima Trilha sonora.
* Sistema de loot, que o torna um diferencial entre os jogos do g√™nero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014353729', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1482009955}
review:
Not to worst clicker game I've ever played, certainly a good way to kill some time.
Never experienced the save glitches some people seem to have, but yes I can confirm there is no way to manually save your game. Also there's no fullscreen options.

One thing to note, I really liked the randomly generated loot, I thought that was a nice touch. However my general consensus would be that these developers cetrainly have some degree of talent, but they're wasting it on the wrong genre. Honestly I feel like if these devs were to make a little RPG or something, it would probably be halfway decent. I mean I would definitely be interested in checking that out.

Bottom line; I feel like this game is wasted talent, but feel free to try it anyway, since it is free afterall. However I still wouldn't openly recommend this game 'cuz it's just nothing special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006798274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1509645679}
review:
En face, This is a visual boosting Clicker heroes with more equipment system.

However microtransaction is inacceptable in such a seriously flawed system.

Though the Day 1 save loss is apparently mended by compansation, this game still have unfogivable problem.

Most of the problem are CALCULATION ERROR and LABLING ERROR.
For instance, Aldur's level 150 ability : ADD 25% str to HERO.
Even we know the game utilize ADDITION SYSTEM instead of MULTIPLICATION SYSTEM of CLICKER HEROES, 
in such early game, even the 25% is ONLY ADDITION, the hero just did not have a ton of booster, so it at least should have effect of several %, however, it only give meagly 0.2% boost

Such laughable error are entangled with another problem, EQUIPMENT COMPARING SYSTEM.
The system is great if IT WORKED FLAWLESS, however, it is not.
When an ITEM shows it should have, for instance 30T DPS boost, it actual may deliver anything, even a negative impact.

It is OK to make the equipment complicated, for instance, in Diablo 3, you cannot just equip green numbered gear.
HOWEVER, THIS GAME HAVE NO CHARACTER SHEET!
hence, what actually a gear DOES work all relied on its HIDDEN, and OBVIOUSLY FLAWED SYSTEM.

In such condition, launch it with microtransaction is unresponsible and unforgivable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057254179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 4017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1491928576}
review:
The game is currently full of bugs.  Once your money reaches a certain point, the counter will hit zero and refuse to change.  I bought an upgrade that cost 8 stars and got charged 9.  One time I unlocked a skill and it wasn't added to the list.  At least the game lets you save now.

A litte more information on the game's basics would be nice.  Like how many stars you'll earn when ascending, since it's a blind leap of faith.  And despite breaking the money counter, I only got 15 measly stars. Maybe I zoned out, but I never caught the benefits of keeping Epic or Legendary equipment, which the game will bug you over upgrading.

Otherwise, there is a good framework for a clicker game here.  The artwork is nice, though your strongest character always has the cash shop icon plastered over his face.  With bug fixes, tweaking, and adding more content, this clicker could earn the $2 it demands.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996890045', 'num_games_owned': 3060, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 8191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7666, 'last_played': 1537465421}
review:
Clicker Guild is a nice little clicker game.
It has some different game mechanics compared to other clicker games, such as the dropped items which can strengthen your heroes - and the way that each of the heroes you buy actually appear on the screen.

You can get 20% to 30% of the 89 achievements quite easily; however, I suspect that getting the rest of them would probably take years of grinding hours of play (like all other clicker games, as far as I am aware of).

If you are after a shooter game, then this is not for you.
It is clearly aimed at clicker game players.

It's not brilliant, but it's ok.
If you like clicker games, then you might as well give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097469990', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1482126322}
review:
Come on. Seriously. How could the idea to use mindless clicking as a game mechanic actually become a trend worth capitalizing on? 

Moving away from the idea behind it, and heading into the game itself, there's a good bit to talk about.

First of all, the graphics themselves aren't good for a game with so many intricate visual details, or at least, details that are unbecoming of a game that expects little of you other than just clicking. 

Second of all, it's drab as hell. Clicker Heros is bright, colorful, and has a whimsical atmosphere. This game has a dull and damp atmosphere. Which leads me into my next point.

Thirdly, this game seems to take itself seriously. Click Heros purposefully takes the piss out of itself in quite a few text lines. It's monsters look silly, it's world is silly, the heros are silly. Here you have a failed attempt at making something as benign as a clicker game, as serious as an RPG. There isn't any stimulation. Good, deep games can be dark, because the game play makes stimulation. A clicker game needs to add it! Which again, brings me into my next point.

Lastly, the additional layer of complexity with the item system does not make this game less of a clicker game. Increasing necessary involvement in the kind of game in which the player wants to be idle, or at the very least mindlessly waste time, is such a silly idea. 

Sadly, this is a well made game, that was definitely made to take the market over with a superior product. The problem is, there is really nothing clever about it other than some interesting game play elements, which aren't so much desired in a clicker game. Good on the developers for making it, but you should perhaps focus your talents on a different kind of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042913113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 281, 'playtime_forever': 1727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1596017222}
review:
[h1]A totally new clicker, yet if feels pretty familiar.[/h1]

[b]Clicker Guild is nothing, if not a beautiful looking game. From the get go, you can see that the developers put a lot of time and effort into making it look great. The animations are pretty smooth, the characters are well drawn. 

That is perhaps why it is disappointing that other areas of the game don't have that same sense of "uniqueness" that the art style does.

Clicker Guild is by no means a bad game, it's very passable. Unfortunately, it doesn't really do much to set itself apart from its competitors. By now, the people who will pick this game up have invested hundreds or even thousands of hours into titles like Clicker Heroes, Adventure Capitalist, or Crush Crush. You know, the mouse killing, time destroying, cookie clicker games that wow us with massive progression with only the click (or several thousand clicks) of a button.

This is perhaps why it's hard to feel an emotional connection to Clicker Guild. 

To be honest, I was hopeful that this was some multiplayer guild focused clicker game, so that probably partially affected my appreciation for a game that turned out to be about you SINGLE PLAYER GUILD, not some awesome clan based experience. That being said, I gave it a shot to see what other areas of the game might redeem it.

Sadly, the games'  biggest focus, the item drop system, is so "throw-away" meaningless that it pretty much becomes a chore to keep up with it. 

Personally, I would have made items 100 times more powerful and 100 times more rare. As it stands, you'll go through 100 items a minute, quickly making that whole "feature" feel redundant. 

Devs, if you read this, I hope you give some thought to that last paragraph. Wink wink, nod nod.

It would be hard to not recommend this game, if only to keep it on your radar. It's free (with an ingame shop, should you desire some boosts for real world cash), and perhaps in time it will continue to get better. 

If I had to choose between this one and Clicker Heroes, I'd choose the latter, perhaps mostly because there is a clan based element to it. If Clicker Guild had any sense, it too would work on adding a social aspect to it, as that's what's kept people playing Clicker Heroes for thousands of hours, while other clicker games can hardly reach the hundreds. 

Anyway, that's my review in a nutshell.

Should you get it? Sure! It's free! As I said before, it's not a bad game, it just fails to give value or purpose to its main differentiating mechanic, and that results with an experience that leaves you feeling "why bother" after a dozen hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982295752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2097, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1491702458}
review:
Clicker Guild is a free to play incremental clicker game sort of the same as Sakura Clicker and Clicker Heroes.  It worked on Win 10, looked good, sounded ok, played ok.  The negative reviews said the game didn't have a Save function, but when i tried the game, it saved when you Closed the game and even saved lootchests to be opened next time you are playing actively and save gold offline.  The music is boring and the sound effects is simple.  It has unique detailed animated hirelings that line up surrounding the single animated enemy in the center, but the enemy are average looking.

 The difference in this game is the gear system.  RNG gear drop from enemy killed and you have to put your cursor on it to compare it with what you have, then you left click to wear it, and right click to sell it.  Dropped gear will disappear after 10ish seconds.  There is different levels of gear from common to legendary.  Gear you are wearing degrades after passing by a boss and each level drops slightly better gear.   You will be more busy checking and picking gear than to be clicking on the enemy.  The devs is actively fixing the game from the feedback.  If you are not paying attention you might put gear on that has lower dps than what you have in that slot, epic and legendary will ask you to confirm, or you might sell gear that you could have used.   Each hireling and your hero has 3 slots for gear.

Give this game a try, maybe you might like it.

For more info:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5AUKb2UYQEU

author: {'steamid': '76561198094803808', 'num_games_owned': 4070, 'num_reviews': 5384, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1482119075}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037325462', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1697413526}
review:
I read plenty of bad reviews but decided to try it anyways simply because how it looked. I loved it especially the gear mechaninc but honestly i wouldnt say its ready yet. It felt like a rushed release with lots of bugs and flaws to fix especially the one that didnt let you save the game which was now fixed. 

I say clicker heroes is the king of clicker games like many would but il say i like this game more if it werent in this beta state feeling. Please devs make it better u got a good game going here dont waste it!

Gear management is great in my opinion gets u thinking what to sell and what not while ur resting your poor fingers XD still needs to be balanced tho, show better whats the dmg u get and lose from equiping it and the fact that u can get very rare gear gear with crit +0,0% and what not... >.< 
WARNING!! be carefull not to click on a gear droped after killing a mob without checking its stats! it is quite easy to do it sadly if your not carefull.

You can get to see your heroes attacking and for me thats rly cool besides trying to get the best gear for everyone of them you can like them as real characters inside a game and not just more dmg per second on ur gameplay. Wish we had a little more info on them.

Give it a try it is fun even if its just for a while in your case.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055089474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1482105575}
review:
Just boring really, as far as clicker games go. There was nothing there to entice me to keep playing beyond the second zone.

Everything is samey, and it all lacks personality. If you're going to give all the characters names instead of calling them by their classes, give them bios or something. 
Music is mediocre, but the visuals at least are nice enough.

The only thing this game has going for it is RPG loot. Items drop and you have to decide whether you want to replace current equipment. Neat but ultimately pointless when it turned out just grabbing whatever had higher DPS was all that mattered.

review:
I was enjoying this clicker game, mainly for the randomized loot.  I didn't have any issues with saving the game, but today I logged on after not playing for a day or so, and I realized that the offline aspect has stopped working.  I have the exact same amount of gold as I did yesterday when I logged off.

I wish more incremental games had randomized loot and stats to mess around with.  But the offline production not working kinda killed this for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998455537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 809, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1482057082}
review:
Yes and no. First off, why no? It's just another clicker game. Why yes? The hero character designs. I loved them so much. I would say that this game has the beginnings of a more interesting game. However, the main gameplay mechanic is a pointless clicker.

My conclusion ultimately falls into "No",

PROS
1. Multitude of Characters
I wanted to watch how it unfolded. 30 different characters that you hire, each of them an unique design. I loved it.

2. Free
That's obvious. There's a shop to buy accelerants but we'll skip that since it's like buying cheats.

3. Offline collection
You can collect money offline

4. Going off and Leaving it Alone
You can just let Clicker Guild run on its own while you eat and do other things.

CONS
1. It's a Clicker
Clicker games are basically pointless clicking.

NEUTRAL
1. A few Monsters
There are less than 3 zones worth of unique monsters. Somewhat less than 30 monsters. After that, it loops and the same design appears.

SUGGESTION
1. Make a better, more engaging game
You have the assets. Do more with them.

review: Very disappointing, obviously hasnt been thought through at all. Item system is horrible and just replaces the item 1st item on the left. That alone makes the game esentially unplayable as a decent item system might set it apart from other clickers. Theres no indication of being able to buy x10 of something (even tho u can with shift) but it doesnt tell you the cost buying 10 would be. Very simple things that should have never made it to the offical release of the game. I might come back in 1-2 weeks to see if its any better I guess.

Also buy x100, x1000 etc could be helpful, too (you have only buy x10). Nevertheless, I like it. Music and the generous loot makes me simply feel good about this game.
